item.title: Our Greatest Weakness
item.description: The three great virtues of a programmer: laziness, impatience, and hubris. – Larry Wall, creator of Perl As a software engineer, you’re trained to optimize for efficiency. Code shouldn’t take up too much space, and it shouldn’t take too long to run. You recognize that every solution makes a trade-off between speed and memory. The actual output of the code itself must find a balance between how quickly it can be released to users and how much technical debt it leaves behind.
